title: Baranaja: A Climate resilient farming practice that produces nutritious foods in Uttarakhand

tasks.task: Participate in a traditional agricultural ceremony or festival involving various crops.
subtasks: Arrive at the festival location.
Choose the appropriate type of Padyati (Ragi) for the ceremony.
Select and gather other crops like Chowlai, Kuttu, and Jor for the event.
Set up the ceremony area with the selected crops and traditional tools.
Engage in discussions about crop types and their significance.
Observe rituals related to the Rod and Jourracal cutting.
Participate in the war simulation with pretend enemies.
Plant various crops such as Padyati, Urad, Mung, and Ghat in the field.
Harvest the crops when ready, including Mandua and Jhar.
Dry the harvested crops in the sun for several months until they become gold-colored.
Process the dried crops, such as separating the leaves from the Mandwawa and J.
Store the processed crops in baskets or vessels.
Cook a dish using the Mandwawa as part of a communal meal.
Contribute a portion of the harvest to a potluck-style sharing event.
Observe the sharing etiquette among different groups (e.g., Muslims and Hindus).
Safeguard personal crops from being taken by others.
Organize a mock battle scenario between different crop types or communities.
Role-play various roles such as soldiers, generals, or support staff.
Use traditional weapons or farming tools as props during the drill.
Execute commands and follow military tactics while simulating battle.

tasks.task: Participate in a traditional agricultural ceremony/festival involving various crops.
Participate in a traditional agricultural ceremony/festival.
Prepare and share a traditional meal.
Attend a symbolic military training or parade.
Participate in a traditional agricultural ceremony or festival involving various crops.
subtasks: Choose the appropriate type of Padyati (Ragi) for the ceremony.
Select and prepare other crops like Chowlai, Kuttu, and Jor.
Set up the ceremony area with the chosen crops and traditional tools.
Engage in discussions about the significance of different crops and their proper use.
Observe rituals related to the Rod and Jourracal cutting.
Participate in a symbolic drill or battle simulation involving various crops.
Plant various crops such as Padyati, Urad, Mung, and Ghat in the field.
Harvest the crops when they are ready, including Mandua and Jhar.
Dry the harvested crops in the sun for several months, allowing the leaves to remain until they turn gold.
Process the dried crops, such as separating the leaves from the Mandwawa and J.
Cook a dish using a specific crop (e.g., Mandwawa) for a communal meal.
Contribute a portion of the harvested crops to the sharing event.
Follow the local customs and etiquette regarding crop sharing, such as Not sharing some types (e.g., Chowlai, Mandir) and respecting individual possessions.
Organize and participate in a battle drill using symbolic weapons or tools.
Role-play various military roles, such as soldiers, commanders, and support personnel.
Align with traditional tactics and roles as part of the ceremony.

tasks.task: Join a traditional agricultural festival involving Padyati (Ragi) and other crops.
subtasks: Select appropriate crops and set up the ceremonial area.
Discuss crop significance and observe rituals.
Participate in symbolic drills and battles.

tasks.task: Execute planting and harvesting of crops like Padyati, Urad, Mung, and Ghat.
subtasks: Plant and tend to the fields.
Harvest at the right time.
Dry and process crops, ensuring proper preservation.

tasks.task: Prepare traditional dishes for communal sharing.
subtasks: Cook selected crops for the meal.
Share dishes according to local customs.
Rehearse roles and tactics as part of the ceremony.
